title: (0Day) G DATA Total Security Incorrect Permission Assignment Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of G DATA Total Security. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of autostart tasks. The issue results from incorrect permissions set on folders. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details:
02/13/24 – ZDI reported the vulnerability to the vendor02/14/24 – the vendor acknowledged the receipt of the report  03/21/24 – the vendor confirmed the reported issue07/18/24 - ZDI asked for updates 07/18/24 – the vendor communicated that the fix will be released during Q4 202410/07/24 – ZDI notified the vendor of the intention to publish the case as 0-day advisory

-- Mitigation: Given the nature of the vulnerability, the only salient mitigation strategy is to restrict interaction with the application
